intro: Hydrocotyle heyneana, commonly known as the broadleaf water shield, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It typically grows in wetland habitats such as marshes, ponds, and slow-moving streams. The plant features floating leaves with a waxy surface and small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its root system helps stabilize soil and improve water quality in aquatic environments. Hydrocotyle heyneana is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its adaptability and environmental benefits.
